page.title: 16HEALTH CONCERNS IN WETHERBY
page.content: Although life expectancy has increased (in Wetherby in 1984 it was 68.9 years for males and 73.8 for females) concern is growing over the general health of the population. Particulary alarming is the number of deaths from heart disease (32.6% of male and 26.5% of female deaths). If all circulatory system diseases are taken into account the figures rise to 47.7% and 48.2%. The other major cause of death is cancer (27.1% and 23.4%) especially lung cancer. Groups such as the Health Council and the British Heart Foundation are trying to reduce the number of deaths from these diseases by advocating changes in people's eating habits, eg reducing the consumption of fats, sugar and salt and increasing the amount of fibre. A reduction in cigarette smoking and alcohol consumption is also encouraged
